title: Prised goods of Sing Buri
text:
Prised goods of Sing Buri 27 Aug 2015 at 03:47 222 viewed 0 comments NEWSPAPER SECTION: LIFE | WRITER: PICHAYA SVASTI - + Until Sept 6, the "1st Prised Goods of Ton Pho and Otop Festival of Sing Buri Fair" will take place at Talat Pha (clothes market) opposite the provincial bus terminal in Ton Pho, Muang district, Sing Buri province. 
Nang Yai puppet making in Sing Buri. 
Visitors will be able to pay respect to the relics of the Lord Buddha and a statue of Luang Pu Rawd of Wat Klang Phrom Nakhon. They can buy a variety of One Tambon One Product (Otop) goods from all districts of Sing Buri and watch cultural performances, as well as concerts by actors and actresses from Kantana Group. 
Before or after this fair, tourists can visit this province's cultural attractions, including the Nang Yai Puppetry Museum of Wat Sawang Arom, the Brahma Shrine, Wat Phra Non Chaksi, Wat Phikun Thong, Wat Chotikaram and the statue of the Ban Bang Rachan heroes in Bang Rachan district. Visit www.tat7.com or call Tambon Ton Pho Administration Organisation on 036-543-430 . Merit-making with honey 
On Sept 27, the "Alms Giving With Honey" tradition will be held at Wat Thong Bor in Bang Pa-In, Ayutthaya province. 
Thai people of Mon descent at Ban Sao Kradong have long followed a tradition to offer sticky rice desserts ( khao tom mud ), honey and sugarcane juice to monks. The Mon believe offering honey to monks brings good fortune. According to Buddhist legend, a monk had a fever, vomited and lost a lot of weight, prompting the Lord Buddha to exempt monks from consuming five kinds of food -- butter, ghee, honey, oil and sugarcane juice -- after midday. Visit www.tiewpakklang.com or call Wat Thong Bor on 089-243-5097 or the Tourism Authority of Thailand's Ayutthaya Office on 035-246-076/7 . Street market in Bangkok 
From Friday to Sunday, the "Chic Steeet Market @Pickadaily Bangkok" will embrace the atmosphere of an old English town on Sukhumvit 77 (On Nut 37-39), from 3-10pm. 
Amid the reproductions of landmarks in London and heritage buildings in Notting Hill, visitors can enjoy shopping at more than 80 stalls featuring handicrafts, DIY products, stationery, clothes, jewellery, home decor goods and products for pets. Visit www.facebook.com/PickadailyBangkok . Photo taking trip to Loei 
From Sept 11-13, the TAT's Loei Office will organise the "Carrying Cameras, Travelling in Loei" trip to Chiang Khan and Phu Rua districts, Loei province. Actress Michelle Burmann, who is the Miss Teen Thailand 2009 first runner-up and played Khun Paen in popular TV series, Neung Nai Suang , will be a model for participants to take pictures at tourist attractions. The trip is limited to 30 people, and costs 2,190 baht per head (including travel, accommodation, food and accident insurance). Call TAT Contact Centre 1672 or the TAT's Loei Office on 042-812-812 . Festival in Malaysia 
Throughout this month, Penang's George Town Festival (GTF) provides a variety of local and international performances, exhibitions and events. 
Among this year's highlights will be the Spanish hip hop/flamenco fusion dance theatre Titanium, the Australian-made highly choreographed musical and dance feature Am I, the Iranian experimental theatre Slow Sound of Snow and Berlin's Rimini Protokoll. 
There will also be two street festivals -- ATM @ Beach Street, or All Things Malaysian, and Butterworth Fringe Festival, or BFF. The former features pop-up shops, installations, dancers, live music and more, and the latter provides a wide range of performances.
